channel.title: Math help?
channel.description:
I'm failing math right now so I need help on these questions.
1. -6+|x-4|=-6
2. |x-42.04|=23.24
3. 8=7-|x|
4. 9=7-|x+2|
5. 2|2x+8|+(2 x 3x) = 180
6. 8-2(x-5)=x+3
7. -2x-5.75=13.25
Show how to solve with the solution! Thanks Very Happy

why cant -x = 8 when you can do x = -8 U STUPID OFCOURSE IT CAN BE NEGATIVE

item.title: Math help?
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Adam:

Yeah yeah, my bad, an Absolute # is always positive; however, doesn’t it need to stay as an Absolute number the whole time? Even in the answer?

It’s called an absolute value, and no.

When you solve for x in an equation like that, you don’t persist the absolute value operator, rather you split it into two equations like TeleNubby did and solve both of them. Then you get your two answers.

You would write the answer as “x = 1 or x = 2”, 1 and 2 being the numbers that would satisfy the equation.

Read full topic

item.title: Math help?
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:4, topic:230233”]You got everything wrong.[/quote]Me or him, specifically?

I’m pretty sure I’m right, as both of these statements are true:
|8| = 8
|-8| = 8

Read full topic

item.title: Math help?
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“Adam, post:3, topic:230233”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=303040.msg2430880#msg2430880 date=1220843215]
1)
-6 + |x-4| = -6
|x-4| = 0
(split into two parts)
(part a)
x - 4 = 0
x = 4
(part b)
-(x - 4) = 0
-x + 4 = 0
-x = -4
x = 4[/quote]

Doesn’t x have to stay as an absolute number? so… x = |4|
Correct me if I’m wrong.

|x-42.04| = 23.24
(split into two parts)
(part a)
x - 42.04 = 23.24
x = 65.28
(part b)
-(x - 42.04) = 23.24
-x + 42.04 = 23.24
-x = -18.8
x = 18.8

Same thing? x = |18.8|

7 - |x| = 8

  • |x| = 8
    NOT POSSIBLE (a negative cannot equal a positive number, in this case 8)

And if I’m right, you can divide by negative. Assume it’s -1.
So? x = |-8|

[quote]
4)
7 - |x+2| = 9

  • |x+2| = 2
    NOT POSSIBLE (see reason for problem 3)[/quote]
    Same thing? x = |-2|

Correct me if I’m wrong on any of these, I haven’t been in math for a while, but I really really think this is how they’re answered.[/quote]
You got everything wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Math help?
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:2, topic:230233”]1)
-6 + |x-4| = -6
|x-4| = 0
(split into two parts)
(part a)
x - 4 = 0
x = 4
(part b)
-(x - 4) = 0
-x + 4 = 0
-x = -4
x = 4[/quote]

Doesn’t x have to stay as an absolute number? so… x = |4|
Correct me if I’m wrong.

2) |x-42.04| = 23.24 (split into two parts) (part a) x - 42.04 = 23.24 x = 65.28 (part b) -(x - 42.04) = 23.24 -x + 42.04 = 23.24 -x = -18.8 x = 18.8
Same thing? x = |18.8|
3) 7 - |x| = 8 - |x| = 8 NOT POSSIBLE (a negative cannot equal a positive number, in this case 8)
And if I'm right, you can divide by negative. Assume it's -1. So? x = |-8|
4) 7 - |x+2| = 9 - |x+2| = 2 NOT POSSIBLE (see reason for problem 3)
Same thing? x = |-2|

Correct me if I’m wrong on any of these, I haven’t been in math for a while, but I really really think this is how they’re answered.

Read full topic

item.title: Math help?
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

-6 + |x-4| = -6
|x-4| = 0
(split into two parts)
(part a)
x - 4 = 0
x = 4
(part b)
-(x - 4) = 0
-x + 4 = 0
-x = -4
x = 4

|x-42.04| = 23.24
(split into two parts)
(part a)
x - 42.04 = 23.24
x = 65.28
(part b)
-(x - 42.04) = 23.24
-x + 42.04 = 23.24
-x = -18.8
x = 18.8

7 - |x| = 8

  • |x| = 8
    NOT POSSIBLE (a negative cannot equal a positive number, in this case 8)

7 - |x+2| = 9

  • |x+2| = 2
    NOT POSSIBLE (see reason for problem 3)

2|2x+8| + (2*3x) = 180
|2x+8| + 6x = 90
(split into two parts)
(part a)
2x + 8 + 6x = 90
8x + 8 = 90
8x = 82
x = 10.25
(part b)
-(2x + 8) + 6x = 90
-2x - 8 + 6x = 90
4x - 8 = 90
4x = 98
x = 24.5

8 - 2(x-5) = x + 3
-2(x-5) = x - 5
-2x + 10 = x - 5
10 = 3x - 5
15 = 3x
5 = x

-2x - 5.75 = 13.25
-2x = 19
-x = 9.5
x = -9.5

This was really simple math. I suggest sticking around after school or getting some form of tutoring if you want to pass your math class. Learn the order of operations, realize that there can be two answers for each absolute value, and you should be good.

Read full topic
